item.title: Golang Variable Shadowing
item.description: Recently I’ve been playing with some code in Go. Code was quite simple, but what I wanted is to simplify error handling a little bit and make code more readable. As many Go developers know, error handling in Go is usually done this way: func templateToFile(templateFilename string, filename string, data interface{}) error { f, err := os.OpenFile(filename, os.O_WRONLY|os.O_TRUNC|os.O_CREATE, 0666) if err != nil { return err } defer f.Close() t, err := template.

item.title: Cyrillic symbols on english Windows 10
item.description: I use english version of Windows 10 but sometimes I have to deal with files that have cyrillic names or with cyrillic commit messages in TortoiseHg. I’ve found that my favorite image viewer XnView doesn’t work properly with cyrillic paths when installed on english Windows: TortoiseHg Workbench have some issues too: That particular issues mean that XnView and TortoiseHg Workbench doesn’t support Unicode. However, there’s a fix for this by applying some settings in Windows.

item.title: Sudo font
item.description: For quite a long time I’ve been searching for the font that looks really close to Envy Code R but have cyrillic support. And finally I’ve found it! Behold the bringer of light - Sudo.
